Reviews.Title: “Boarding house not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jess M
Reviews.Content: Walking in here was like walking into the reception of a mental hospital. The room was really gross, crappy small old bed, just manky and dirty looking. The other "guests" were more like long term mental patient boarders, because the whole place is more like a boarding house than a hotel. I would not call this a hotel. There is no phone in the room to call reception, it is expensive for how awful it is (even though its likely the cheapest), and we did not feel safe there whatsoever. I would not recommend staying here. The Olde Town Inn, however, is about the same price or less, and is AMAZING. Stay there instead!

Reviews.Title: “Very affordable with lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: nadaturnerbaby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling through New Orleans on our way to Florida. We found this nice little hotel while site seeing in Treme. They had off street parking which was a plus. Upon coming in the hotel it was very clean and the clerk was very friendly. While checking us in we asked her what are somethings we can do while in New Orleans and she set us up a tour for the next morning as well as places to eat for dinner and breakfast. The room was clean and it smelled nice. We had a lovely time overall. In fact we stayed an extra night because it was such a lovely place and New Orleans is as well. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimber D
Reviews.Content: My friend booked this room for us to attend her wedding and we did not see or hear anything about the hotel before arriving there. It is in a horrible area and is one of the creepiest experiences I ever had. Literally stayed for 10 minutes and just lost our money spent on the room without argueing about it. Blood stain on the bed, no lock on the door, hotel has a curfew, bathroom was tiny and disgusting, tv is over the bed, weird desk clerk, ect. Don't even waste your time or money. Seriously would compare this place to a 1940's horror movie.

Reviews.Title: “Just a place to go and sleep”
Reviews.Author: Smedina8
Reviews.Content: If you need a place to crash while you are out on Bourban street having fun then this place is suitable for your needs. If you are needing something more classy then don't go here. We paid for what they classified for a 'large' room and quite frankly it was small. My fiance laughed and called the place a prison but I thought it was fine. It was indeed small and only had a bed and a small chair in the bedroom. The bathroom was small with no amenities. Like I said we checked in super late and went straight out and came in late and were there for the one night. It fit our needs and it was cheap. Within walking distance to Bourban too if you aren't gonna get too intoxicated that is. . . and i have a feeling one can smoke in their room cause their were ashtrays.

Reviews.Title: “Run Away!”
Reviews.Author: Timesq R
Reviews.Content: My first clue that this was a poor choice of hotel was the cab drivers comment "I've never driven anyone from the airport to this hotel" and "please stay indoors after dark". The staff is pleasant. The room is about 8x6. There is no phone to call the front desk or call 911 in an emergency. The bed sheets were clean, the blanket has probably not been washed in months. There is a small area rug that smelled foul. There is a 13 inch TV. The bathroom could use a good scrubbing. The shower curtain was mouldy. They give you small bar of soap with a small towel. The shower spritzed out a little bit of water in every direction. In summary this was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. If you are just looking for a bed for the night and don't care how clean it is and don't really need to shower, this may work for you. I paid an average of $73 a night.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Empress Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shirley t
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely wonderful time in New Orleans to attend the French Quarter festival in April. It was the first time I had ever been to New Orleans and I will be back again. I could not believe how well situated the hotel is to the Quarter. I had no trouble getting around and the staff at the hotel was wonderful. I will use the Empress the next time I go to New Orleans. Thank u Empress ShirleyTyler

Reviews.Title: “It does what it's intended to do...”
Reviews.Author: Castafiore002
Reviews.Content: Well it is well situated, the hotel is two blocks from the French Quarter, on a quiet and very colorful street. If you're on budget and want to stay away from the craziness of the French Quarter, the Empress hotel is fine and does the job. Hopefully you're not coming to New Orleans to spend time in your room. The room is basic, our room was a decent size, the bathroom was a bit small, but the room was clean. We booked our room for two nights, we arrived around noon, even though check-in is at 3, but since our room was ready, they let us checked in. The lady at the front desk was very nice. Based on the reviews from tripadvisor, my friend and I inspected the room, bathroom and sheets, everything was clean. Bed was too soft for my liking. Room felt a bit musty though, air was a bit stale. My one complaint, is that after our first night, they did clean the room, changed the sheets and gave us new towels, but the they did not clean the bathroom floor (no bath math is provided, do not recommend walking bare feet in the bathroom) that was a bit gross. My friend's complaint is that her towel was not clean... So all that being said, the hotel is fine for one or two nights, more than that might be stretching it...

Reviews.Title: “Left me sleeping in my car!”
Reviews.Author: JennaLmcmullen
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel and sent in my confirmation with CC # by the specified time. Only when I called for a clarification on my check while I was en route to New Orleans did I find out that they had clearly overbooked and would not be supplying me with the room they had promised upon my reservation. On St Patricks day weekend there was no other room to be found in the city. We were left for 2 night with no hotel room!!!!! I called the hotel and the "administration" several times ad they refused to right the situation. They did not seem to care at all and in fact expected me to understand their policy of overbooking. I am a very tolerant person and have never complained about a hotel in my life, even upon finding mold, but confirming a reservation and then backing out is unforgivable! DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE SLEEPING IN YOUR CAR!

Reviews.Title: “A Real Treasure in Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo699
Reviews.Content: A wonderful place to stay...just 5 min walking distance to Burbon Street...the accommodations are modest but definitely have a character and kept clean. Private bathrooms, free parking, free coffee on the balcony first thing in the morning..the staff are AWESOME - i arrived about 7 in the morning Sunday and check in was not til 4 pm. The hotel staff did their best to make me feel welcome AND at 10 AM i was already in my room. Would definitely stay there again when visiting New Orleans next time.

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay cheaply in New Orleans!!”
Reviews.Author: StephaniB69
Reviews.Content: Checked in on FRiday afternoon this past weekend and quick and easy check in! Parked right out on street in front of hotel as there was no parking left in parking lot. Car sat there until Sunday and was never bothered. Stayed in room 212. Yes- not like the Holiday Inn or even the Hampton but a good cheap place to lay your head.We had read the reviews and even stayed here once before so we brought a sleeping bag to put over the bed covers. The hot water was HOT and the air conditioner was COLD. People were loud walking the hallway but it didn't bother us much. We were only in the room to sleep and get ready. Had to wait a while to get a taxi. It was St Patty's day and town was busy! The taxi drivers reminded us not to walk in the area at night and we told them we already knew! It was a 8.50 cab fare to and from the casino. will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A budget price, but still a GOOD night's sleep.”
Reviews.Author: Fox V
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Empress Hotel. I had been running around trying to find a place for the night and walked in just looking for a place to sleep, and I was more than pleasantly elated! The staff was accomodating, the clerk helped me get my things to my room, and I didnt really have much to carry. The entry was tidy, and even the flowers were neatly arranged. I think this place deserves kudos for actually placing something there that I still remember having seen even after I left. The hotel was pretty quiet, and when you just want a good night's sleep this is definitely a bonus! My room was tidy, bed neatly made, the bathroom cleaned, and cozy. I'm a picky person, and this place really hit the spot for me, and I slept very soundly. For the price I paid this hotel was worth it, and I ended up deciding to stay another night. Thank you, Empress Hotel and staff. Next time I'm in New Orleans, expect to see me again!

Reviews.Title: “Empress made extended Accomodations Elderly Uncle!”
Reviews.Author: Citizen_Ron_C
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the lady that owns/manages this facility. She was very accommodating to my octogenarian uncle who needed more than just a room but, the kindness and congeniality that was beyond the role of the typical hotelier. A great location to the world famous French Quarter/Vieux Carre with reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to sleep in dirty p p-sheets and get @ids, this is perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nate T
Reviews.Content: This place is gorgeous! Five star! Any positive or ok review was definitely not written by the hotel, a customer wrote it. This is the least disgusting place I have ever seen. It is not a scam at all. They didn't lure us in with fake hotel photos. Then we signed up and after we saw (how awesome) the room (was) they would not refund our money (it was too awesome for us). 1. This is great if you want to get a feel of what a g&y-prostituti-n hot bed is like - it was like we were on bleepin' tv! amazing! 2. There was a really cool hole in the floor - a big one - it was exciting because we don't know how far down it goes!! 3. It was exciting because it smelled like p*e and was obviously uncleaned - other people that night found used razor blades and used soap in their "$130 room." 4. The bathrooms were exciting and built trust because they couldn't close since they were half ripped off (the top hing was almost entirely ripped off, probably by some cool-a5s plmp) I got to shlt in front of my date if I had to! Hahahaha, who doesn't want an excuse to do that?! 5. The excitement was sky-high because the sprinklers were cut! Fire meant certain death - eXciTiNg!!!!!! 6. If you've ever wanted to see protltutes in the wild - they are everywhere! They surround this place! Awesome! 7. There were cool razor blade marks all over from cutting up (baby asprin?!) it made it authentic and real!! Rustic! 8. They found a dead h0oker in one of the rooms a few weeks before we got there - did she die of excitement?!! 9. The bathroom floor was caving in (preparing us for our swaying cruise) and smelled like celebrity urine. Were we in a room with celebrity urine?! I hope so! I took a swab home for my collection! 10. The ice bucket was already used and dirty when we got there (I almost stole it as a momento - was it Johnny Depp who used it last?!!!?!?!??!!!) 11. They won't let you leave the premesis with the keys or you are charged an extra $10. (I assume so many people steal the keys to prove they actually were awesome enough to stay in such an awesome establishment). 12. The theme or our room - I can only assume - was "celebrity toilets" - it must have been because there were a bunch of used run-down toilets out our window, in front of a house that looked like it was about to fall down (movie prop??!?!!?!!?) 13. The grease-like substance which covered nearly everything was left in-tact for our enjoyment (celebrity c*m?!!!) 14. We didn't want to disturb the sheets - which were obviously used many times over by celebrities - I think a few of them had even pissed on them based on the smell!! 15. Someone (I assume they were high-profile) was bold enough to put his/her cigs out on the coffee table! Oh, boy! 16. A bald, cross-dressed (celebrity?!!) pretending to be a pr0stitute was arguing over his "rent" (lol) when we got there. 17. They even pay a man to dress like a pimp and pretend to be eye-f@cking your date when you come/go - just so it's exciting!!!! 18. I kinda fell for all the stagecraft - I really felt like myself or my date was actually going to get raped! I wouldn't even let her go in the hallway while I cr@pped with the door open!!! (There were "s#x" noises like crazy in the hallway - so authentic. We couldn't even find their speakers! So real!) 19. There was more awesomeness - but I can't divulge it all and ruin it! 20. They wouldn't give the people (who obviously thought it was a ReAL wh0rehouse) their money back! These people thought it was a scam, lol!!! 21. I'm not making any of this up - they went to that level of trouble to make sure you had the experience of a "real new orleans wh0rehouse!" for only $75 - $175 and up!! 22. They really want it to feel authentic, because they even pay the taxi drivers to drop off un-suspecting tourists! Can you imagine how scared they'd be if they thought it was all real?!! Go here! I don't think you'll get aids.

Reviews.Title: “just fine for a traveler but”
Reviews.Author: mari07z
Reviews.Content: perhaps not for a tourist. Great for people who want to save their money for things other than their hotel. Yes, the rooms are funny with their super- high- up- tiny- television and hanging space heater and the beds are kind of small for two people. Actually, there is no view or any reason really to hang around in your room or the hotel but, it's New Orleans! Why would you want to?!? The ten dollar price you must pay to have a guest stop by is real LOL (even if your friend just wants to use the bathroom) but, we found that all kind of funny. The location is great and, having read some reviews, as I first walked towards there my first night I kept waiting for the neighborhood to turn ugly and scary, but it never did. With that said, I have lived in many places around the world and currently live in a major city so for someone who is used to chain hotels I do not recommend this. For someone who is accustomed to traveling and perhaps staying at hostels etc. it is fine, not perfect, but funny and fine.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: unhappy318
Reviews.Content: This hotel if you would call it one was AWEFUL the rooms are not fit for stray animals. The night we stayed, it was ROBBED! Yes thats what I said. Not safe, not clean, very loud and inconciderate guest. Nice employees, I feel for the employees, but they need employment too. Think twice before staying at this "hotel".....

Reviews.Title: “Its not all bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine--xxxx
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed at this hotel when we were travelling around America, we wanted somewhere central and cheap so decided to book the Empress! Its quite out-dated and old fashioned, but our room was ok, nothing special at all, but it had everything we needed. The bathroom was VERY small, but it was ok as there were only two of us and we were only staying for a couple of nights. One night we were woken to the sound of an argument in the corridor outside our room, luckily it didnt effect our sleep too badly. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. There was a free parking lot outside which we left our car at during the entire trip which was very useful (our car was fine, despite the fact that the hotels in a supposedly rough area). The location was ideal for us, a few minutes walk from Bourbon Street, the French Quarter, lots of bars, restaurants and shops. In fact the hotel is situated perfectly- its close enough to the hustle and bustle of Bourbon street yet far enough away when its bed time!! Overall, I would reccommend this hotel to travellers and young people who are just looking for a place to sleep. Despite our mainly positive experience I would'nt really reccommend it to families with kids, as there were a couple of undesirable guests around. Its a no frills hotel, and you really do get what you pay for- as long as your not expecting 5* luxury this hotel is fine!

Reviews.Title: “Its horrible, we'll never coming back!”
Reviews.Author: dejavu85
Reviews.Content: This place is at the hood of new orleans. I was dissappointed coz when I checked in they ask me for a $10 deposit then when I get to the room it was so hot coz they did not turn the AC on and the room is small, the tv is very tiny, they only give you 1 towel and 1 face towel. The horrible thing is that when its time to check out, you better check out before 12 noon or you won't get your $10 deposit. One more thing, dont leave even just one small stain on the towels and sheets or they are going to charge you for it! What a dissappointment that they would rather charge you for the towels and sheets than try and make you come back for the next time!

Reviews.Title: “Will never patron again.”
Reviews.Author: JLenore
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were in town for the Essence Music Festival and selected the selected the empress hotel for the great cost and close proximity to the french quarter (just a two block walk). I have read reviews prior to making reservations, but the nightly rate was too good for me to pass up. We arrive, the exterior looked pretty decent, as did the lobby. While going through the process of checking in, we were told that there was a $10 deposit required of all guests- the deposit is to ensure compliance to hotel rules. I was a bit turned off by this surprise fee (as it was not mentioned to me during previous communications with staff), but I could understand why such measures were necessary. On to the room - It'll help for you to know that it was 96 degrees (F), with a heat index of 110 degrees. On the second floor, where our room was located, there is NO A/C in hallway - they also keep the balcony doors open around the clock, so there's never any real relief when the weather is on "Hell". We enter our room - it was even more unbearable than the hallway! There is a small a/c unit of prehistoric design, which is immediately turned on upon our entry. The accomodations are meager; small room, possibly 10ft X10ft, equipped with a small bed, chair, nightstand, portion of rug, a mirror and then the bathroom. My boyfriend and I decide to give the a/c a chance to work while check out the city and, much to our dismay, the clerk informs us that THE A/C IN NOT ALLOWED TO RUN WHEN NO OCCUPANTS ARE IN THE ROOM. <-- In 100 degree heat!! We later found out that throughout the day, front desk clerks enter each room with the sole purpose of turning of a/c units! And forget the fact that it takes at least 2hours of constant running for even the most minute of temperature change to occur! Further exploration turned up dirty pillowcases; The toilet lever was ghetto-rigged ( you had to lift up and rotate level for 10 seconds or so before the commode flushed); The tub had a slow drain - I mean, this place was just awful. They don't have an ice machine - instead you must purchase ice from the front desk - $5.00 per bag! Laughable! And this, this takes the cake - after a night of partying, we return to our room, I enter the bathroom to find a COCKROACH crawling along the perimeter of the bathtub! As for the other guests we encountered during our stay - "unkempt" is perhaps the best term to use. Dressed in dingy wear, hair untamed and in need of washing....they rent our rooms by the hour. I can just imagine how much of their business comes from the patronage of prostitutes. If you're only looking for a place to secure your luggage and are willing to lower your standards in regard to service, then this place will address your needs perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “horrible place”
Reviews.Author: livesinnola
Reviews.Content: Are you people delusional I live and work in New Orleans this hotel is horrible ridden with hookers, drug addicts and murderers please do not be fooled with those pictures that place is horrible white female just overdosed in the bathroom three days ago, and when you get there to see you have been duped you will not get your money back you will get the runaround and you will lose. The staff is rude and the rooms smell like urine. But you donâ€™t have to take my word for it you will see then think back to my message. Anybody who have been there know what Iâ€™m talking about itâ€™s a horrible place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location,Clerks very helpful and friendly and SO worth the money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nadaturnerbaby
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what you pay for.....My friends and I wanted a Nice Cheap place to stay and the Empress was the choice...When we arrived the had a nice clean parking lot that was monitored which i LOVED! When we enter the hotel we were greeted by a very nice clerk. she answered all of our questions and told us alot of places to see and check out while we were in town. And i kinda loved the fact that they wanted us to leave the key cause i'd sure misplace it lol. The room was very clean and cozy. it was a very pleasent stay. The hotel was very quiet..seemed like a nice litte hotel. i recommened you stay at this hotel if you want to save your money and just want somewhere to crash..

Reviews.Title: “Smells terrible and no refunds”
Reviews.Author: traveler2245034
Reviews.Content: We booked two single rooms, when we went in the rooms, there was a very strong urine smell, absolutely could not stay there. The clerk said she would not refund any money although we only stepped in the room and prompty left. DO NOT BOOK A ROOM HERE We were lucky to find a room elsewhere, and had to forfeit the cost of the room

Reviews.Title: “Great value and convenient to everything”
Reviews.Author: Ishka15
Reviews.Content: I have traveled to New Orleans many times, sometimes on more of a budget than other times, and this trip hit the mark. I found this little gem of a place just 2 blocks to the French Quarter, close to bus lines, restaurants, clubs, etc. The place is clean and so very friendly. The staff is helpful, kind and gracious ...honestly they are like family members, genuinely interested in you, and offer to help in anyway that makes your stay enjoyable. Being there for Mardi Gras made my trip and my stay at the Empress all the more fun.

Reviews.Title: “UNFORGETTABLE!”
Reviews.Author: hallander1
Reviews.Content: Looking back at my stay at the Empress Hotel, all I can do is laugh. This place was ridiculous. A few friends and I traveled to New Orleans for the Sugar Bowl (Ohio State vs. Arkansas). I was in charge of booking the hotel and my requirements for the hotel were that it was cheap and close to bourbon street. The Empress was perfect. When we arrived, the two janitors seemed to be having a little spat about what their general cleaning duties were supposed to be. The older janitor was telling the younger one that he needed to be more diligent about cleaning the rooms and making sure he changed the linens out of every room when the occupants checked out. Ummm..... When we first entered our room, all we did is stare for a minute or two. I am almost positive that a hooker must have used our room right before we arrived. The bed spread was ruffled about, the pillows were thrown around on the bed, there was a fresh cigarette butt in the ash tray next to the bed, and there was a used wash cloth and bar of soap in our sink. Luckily, my friends and I brought extra sheets, blankets, bath towels, pillows, and toiletries. One of the first things we did is check for bed bugs and there were none. Wheww!!! The room was about the size of a jail cell with one window (that you couldn't see out of), a tiny tv, and a small chair. There was also a rug that was cut in half placed on the side of the bed. Our shower looked like it hadn't been cleaned in months. yuck. The good thing I can say about the Empress is that it served its purpose well. The only time we were at the hotel was to sleep and get ready in the morning. It was very close to Bourbon street and it was cheap. When I checked out, I had no problems, but my friend who had stayed in another room at the Empress had a little trouble. They refused to give back her key deposit because she failed to turn her key in to the front desk every time we went out even though she returned the key to them upon checking out. Overall, we had an awesome trip! In the future, we probably won't stay here again, but it was definitely an unforgettable place.

Reviews.Title: “Great price.....sucky service AND they will trick you out of your money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: billybobbb
Reviews.Content: To be perfectly honest, I wanted the cheapest price close to the quarters and agreed to the room after seeing it . The clerk read all of the rules to me EXCEPT she conveniently forgot one(which I will get to). After sitting my luggage down and turning on the TV, I came out of the room and so happened to run into a hooker who politely informed me that if I had a guest there would be an $11 charge. I was not happy with this and went immediately to the clerk who confirmed what I was told. I told her she never read that rule to me and AT THAT TIME, she showed it to me on the wall(how freaking nice!). I asked for my money back and was informed that once you pay there are NO REFUNDS. Keep in mind, I had not been there 20 minutes and had not used the room at all. The clerk would not give me the manager or owners number but claimed to have called them with no answer after 5pm. Why would she call since it was after 5 and you know they don't answer. VERY shady and I will never go back. Keep in mind that I am there every weekend in town and have recommended hotels to over 75 people. This is the worst by far. STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel, but the staff was great and location so convenient to the French Quarter!”
Reviews.Author: thegossipguy
Reviews.Content: So it wasn't the best looking hotel, but I only had to walk a few blocks to get to the great French Quarter and even downtown. It was great exercise. The staff was very friendly. The rooms, not so great, but I didn't plan on staying in the room long at all. It was just a place to rest after a few long nights of awesome fun out on the town. If you're looking for elegance and room service and swimming pools, stay downtown. If you need something very inexpensive and you're booking very last minute, then Empress Hotel might do it for you.

Reviews.Title: “Craptastic and they lied about the HBO”
Reviews.Author: jmathiau666
Reviews.Content: Don't worry about the neighborhood it looks worse than it is.Unlike the hotel where it looks better than it is.It was a cold night and the heater didn't work.I had to ask for toilet paper and the shower poured out water like a faucet so i was forced to take a bath.There was no HBO as advertised and I was rudely asked to leave the room at 10:30 even though checkout was at 11 am.For 55 dollars you can do a lot better,like Louis Armstrong park

Reviews.Title: “Helped my family in a time of need.”
Reviews.Author: mmsvcs
Reviews.Content: My family had a death and we had to travel to New Orleans for the funeral. We needed a place to stay for a few nights and were told the Empress would be our best bet since our family was on a budget. We went to the Empress, and were amazed at how nice, polite the staff were when we came in. They gave us some of the best service we had since we arrived in New Orleans. The Clerk was friendly and very helpful. Our room was very neat and clean and if we needed anything the clerk was more than happy to help us the best they ccould. The clerk and housekeeper even gave us directions to where ever we wanted to go. It was a great hotel to stay at and I told the rest of my family where we should stay next time we are in New Orleans. The Empress was wonderful to us in our time of need and we will stay there again next time we visit New Orleans. I will let all my friends and family know where to go if there are in this situation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value In The Big Easy!!!”
Reviews.Author: g_rubins
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to New Orleans for the first time this past April. We found this Hotel on the interent and was so happy with the price compared to the other hotels around the Famous French Quarter. This was great because i wanted to save alot of money to take my wife around as it was the first visit. When we came to the hotel we seen its just two blocks from the french quarter which is great seeing as we could just walk and save our gas. Everything you need is in walking distance! The hotel staff was very helpful and friendly. There is always a clerk if you need them and when you have to pick up your room key. which is great so i dont have to worry about losing it. The clerk was able to tell us some great places to checkout while we were in town which i thought was very nice. They have coffee every morning on the balcony and a soda and snack machine. The hotel was clean and tidy. i would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to free up there money to enjoy the great sites in new orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Katrina should have taken this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: soozyq1225
Reviews.Content: Ah-- where to begin---here are a few highlights-- When my husband and I heard of this hotel - it seemed to be an ok place to stay - being reasonably priced and within walking distance to the French Quarter -- nice picture of the outside of the hotel on the site-the desk clerk even said that it was not in the best neighborhood that we should really not walk after 9:00pm--- it was 10.00 more a night for my husband to stay with me in the room-even though they knew he was staying -we got an allowance of one towel a day -and they only came one way - like sand paper!- he has a lung problem ,in that he doesn't take to the heat well-- we went out for the day and left the a/c running- (as in every hotel we ever stayed in)--when we came back after a fun but HOT and HUMID new orleans day -we opened the door to a wall of heat - they had shut off the air while we were gone!!!!- and note this was not your average hotel a/c - this was a window air conditioner that was at the very least 15 years old! it wasn't even in the window right -we went to complain and the desk clerk she said thats what we do here-i don't own the place i just work here ,theres nothing i can do-- the bathroom was like a rest stop gas station bathroom the shower curtain was like saran wrap and it was nailed to the one side of the shower wall. the bed was hard as a rock under the fitted sheet was a rubber sheet??!! what was that all about?! i shutter to think! -- if we ever go to nola again i will not stay at this hotel -i can't think of one thing that i liked about it --only that it as close to the french quarter--save up a few extra dollars and stay at a DECENT place------honestly---- i wouldn't board my dog here!-- think about it! check out the attached pics--

Reviews.Title: “MOST UNFRIENDLY SERVICE EVER”
Reviews.Author: nolatraveler1
Reviews.Content: Not only is the hotel disgusting as you can see from the photos posted by other guests, but the neighborhood is terrible, and the employees are just plain rude. I don't know how establishments like this are allowed to steal from innocent tourists continuously and regularly. This business makes a mockery of the customer service relationship and should not be allowed to operate. Seriously, please consider yourself warned, a reservation at this hotel will surely leave you unsatisfied and unhappy about your choice!

Reviews.Title: “Do not book this place unless youre a fan of ghetto crackhouse motels.”
Reviews.Author: SpecialAgentUtah
Reviews.Content: The worst place i have ever stayed at in my life. Super shady and sketchy. Would have rather been better off sleeping on the corner next to a bum.

Reviews.Title: “Madi Gras 2010”
Reviews.Author: ladyciroc
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Madi Gras and i can honestly say, IT WASN'T THAT BAD... i read all the reviews before i booked this hotel, and i came prepared. i brought sheets, towels and cleaning supplies. the hotel is rather ghetto, for instances they painted the inside of the tub lol and the toliet was the kind you find in public restrooms and flush with your foot. But my main purpose for the hotel was sleeping, and my bed was comfortable, and the shower was extra hot. my only complaint was that i was cold at night, and the walls are paper thin... I felt safe at all times, i dont know where these other people are from that reviewed this hotel, but im from Baltimore, MD and i didnt feel as if it was located in the ghetto, ive seen the ghetto... dont get me wrong it wasnt the best of areas, but we walked home almsot every night and never felt in danger. all these people want to do is get drunk and have fun... so if you take my advice, you will be prepared and should have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “What a dump”
Reviews.Author: nydcturtle
Reviews.Content: DO not book a room in this place.The rooms are filthy and they have a very nasty smell. I wish I would have seen the other reviews before i was unlucky enough to get trapped in that nightmare. To top it off, they won'teven let you keep your own key. This place is a total s hole. I didn't even stay and payed for another hotel. PLease, don't waste your money or dignity JWK

Reviews.Title: “Great Location; Terribly Disgusting and Nauseating”
Reviews.Author: zigstaa
Reviews.Content: I am in my mid-twenties as are my friends. There was 8 of us on the trip, and we only live an hour away from N.O. The location is really the only thing halfway decent with this place. And that is even a little iffy. Being the age we are and being in New Orleans for one night to go to the Saints game, one would think it wouldnt really matter where we stayed. I would never in my right mind recommend this hotel to a pack of wild dogs. The place was as clean as it could be, but you got the instant feeling that there was more than one room being used by prostitutes and heroin junkies. Yeah, its really that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Pay for a hostel, get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: evangelioness
Reviews.Content: What people don't seem to understand about this hotel is that most hotels in the area cost upwards of $150/night. The empress, on an off season, costs about $30 so you are getting the same as a european hostel - safe hotel, clean beds, basic amenities and locked doors. You can't expect more for your money that so I will say that it is conveniently located, the room has always been clean since I've stayed 7-8 times and since most people never do more than crash in their rooms, why stay more in there than you need to? It's a bargain!

Reviews.Title: “WRONG TURN”
Reviews.Author: ladyvchicago
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I was searching the internet for hotels in New Orleans to attend the Madi Gras and we found the Empress hotel, the rates were reasonable and the distance was not far from the French Quarter for all the events, there wasn't many pictures to see on the site, but what we seen, didn't look so bad although it was just a picture of the outside building. I called the number and spoke with the owner who made this hotel sound so spectacular! We thought we were lucky, anyway after driving 14 hours we couldnt find this hotel and the area look dangerous. I ask this lady who seem to be very nice for directions and she insist that we follow her there. Before she left she told us to be very careful and don't go past the bridge. Well the hotel was not far from the bridge. I immediately had doubts staying there, but after the 14 hour drive all we wanted to do was rest. We were to check-in at 11am. When we went in the hotel the lobby looked alright, but the room was not ready, we had to wait 2 hours. I was very pissed. Finally the room was ready so the clerk walked us to our room. When she opened the door, the room was very small that had a tiny television hanging over this full size bed that was supposed to be a king size, only 3 channels to watch, the room smelled funky, the bathroom was old and rusted out, the mattress was old with this real cheap blankets over it, the window was so small with this fan sitting by it, there was nowhere to put our clothes. I thought I was going to sufficate. The people that was staying there appeared to look like crack heads or prostitutes. I was so upset words could not describe this horrible experience. I immediately went to the owner and ask for my money back. Well the owner stated that she don't give refunds and to take this matter up with your bank. I almost caught a case. We left before that happened. I regret I every seen the "EMPRESS HOTEL" that should have been called the "CRACK HOTEL" IF YOUR PLANNING A TRIP TO NEW ORLEANS PLEASE DON'T STAY AT THE EMPRESS HOTEL., SAVE YOUR SELF THE MONEY, TIME AND HEADACHE CUZ THIS [--] IS NOT WORTH IT. This health hazzard has been reported to the Better Buisness Bureau. "The Empress hotel what a big [--] joke!

Reviews.Title: “Run for your life!”
Reviews.Author: nuggiechicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Empress Hotel on Dec. 27, 2008. My stay ended early. The room was less than desirable and I later learned that there was no phone in the room. No way to reach the desk clerk. I wasn't pleased to be staying there as they changed my room from upstairs to down when they realized I had a dog. I asked about taking my dog on the balcony upstairs and I was told that she wasn't allowed there due to liability. This was supposed to be a pet friendly establishment. Even with all of the discomfort I knew that I signed a non-refundable contract and that I had to make the best of the accomodations. I settled in for the night and just as I fell asleep there was a knock on the door and it was a man. I was staying alone in this hotel and when I heard the knock I was startled. I immediately jumped up and asked who was there he didn't answer me and then told me to open the door. I refused to open the door and then he repeated his actions again. I got really scared when I realized that I didn't have a phone in the room to alert the desk clerk. The man knocked again and told me to open the door. I shouted out that I was not going to open the door and for him to go to the front desk. Then I took my cell phone and called my son crying and asked him to come and pick me up. It was he that alerted the desk clerk who was doing laundry when he arrived. She told him that she heard nothing and saw nothing. After he arrived and we searched to internet for another hotel to stay in. As of now I have called several times to the hotel in an effort to get a refund for something that was out of my control and to see what the owner had to say and I was told each time that someone would call me back. Finally I spoke to the owner who was rude and told me that she was going to look at the surveilence tapes after we hung up. Before we got disconnected she reinforced her position that I signed a non-refundable contract. She also asked me where I was staying assuming that I had left to stay with my son at "his apartment". I assured her that I had checked into another hotel and that I was not staying with my son. We got disconnected upon her inquiry as to where I was staying and as of yet I have not heard back from her. So that is my review if you want to stay here be prepared for anything that might happen knowing full well that there are no phones in the room and scant locks on the doors with no peep-holes to look out of if someone decides to knock on your door in the middle of the night and that you don't have anyway to access the desk clerk if there is an emergency. I hardly think that safety is anything that you can exchange for a reduced price. I don't think I will hear back from the owner of this so called hotel... I wish her the best of luck and it is a shame that the only way she can make a buck is by taking advantage of other's. Too bad she doesn't have the decency to refund my money as an effort of good faith and to value her reputation as the owner of the EMPRESS HOTEL! WHAT A JOKE....By the way it cost me $446.00 and the cost of another hotel to ensure my safety. You might just opt for something more reasonable. This place is a dump, smoke laiden, with mold residue and blood stained bed covers. If you decide to stay there have fun!

Reviews.Title: “The EMPRESS Hotel Is Conveniently Located”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bee57
Reviews.Content: I was referred to the Empress by a close friend, and business associate. He recommended that I stay at the Empress since I did not want to pay alot for a hotel, and yet still be close to the FRENCH QUARTER. The Empress Hotel was VERY reasonably priced and the location to the French Quarter could not be beat ! I am not a person to spend alot of time in my hotel room. I much prefer to take tours, ride the streetcar, and walk around the city during the day. I am not a rich woman, so I would rather go to New Orleans and spend money on shopping, and dining in the finest restaurants....NOT on High Priced Hotel Accommodations. The Empress provided clean rooms, with a very courteous front desk staff. They were helpful in suggesting restaurants and various tourist attractions. When I travel to Europe, I am accustomed to staying at smaller / lower priced motels that are centrally located. The Empress Hotel is for the budget minded traveler, who prefers to spend their money things other than a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews Brought Back Painful Memories!!!”
Reviews.Author: laidbackindaguy
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews for this place brought back nightmares from a few years back. When Katrina hit town I had hoped she had wiped this place off the map! I went to NOLA for a weekend several years back, and not being familiar with the city, unwisely booked a room here. Everything appeared normal from the street, but after walking in I started feeling uneasy. The uneasiness was compounded after opening the door to my room! I was on the ground floor right next to the hotel laundry room. Have you ever tried to sleep while clothes dryers and washing machines ran late at night? When asked about the noise and possibly changing rooms the owner became rather indignant! Saying she owned a small place and could not afford to fix the place up like she wanted. She would be glad to change my room for an additional room charge! I would rather sleep on a crypt in the St. Louis Cemetery than stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time in the big easy”
Reviews.Author: ECH71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Empress for the New Year and I have to say it is not a 5star hotel but for the price I was very happy the staff was very helpful and the location was great only 5 a five minute walk to Bourbon Street. I would highly recomend this hotel for the budget minded traveler. 5 Stars in my book!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: randvic
Reviews.Content: Terrible is way too gracious rating for this hotel. If you enjoy, Spiders crawling on you in your sleep, Roches, Black Mole, Continously damp "wet" floors, pancake pillows, stinky comforter on a springy full size matress, space heater that is either on or off (No Thermostate), NO door nobs, no phone, 9" tv with no remote, not to metion the view out of a 1 1/2' x 1' window, then this place is for you. IT SHOULD BE CONDEMED! NO WAY - DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “The most horrendous experience of my life.”
Reviews.Author: AFJones
Reviews.Content: Nothing could have prepared us for this dingy little place. If you think the reception is bad wait til you see your room. How can I describe it. It makes me laugh when they say european style hotel. It was so small and dirty (coachroaches galore). If this place wasn't bad enough the location is anything but safe. You have been warned.

Reviews.Title: “The swamps were cleaner!”
Reviews.Author: ldarz
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked a room at this place through a travel agency. When we arrived,it appeared to be a decent place. So I asked if we could book our room for two more nights. No problem. On our 3rd night when we arrived back at the motel,we asked for our room key only to be told we didn't have a room. They said we never booked it any additional nights. Not only did they give our room away,they packed our personal belongings up and locked them away! Now we had no room and no belongings!What a horrible place.After a few choice words,they gave us another room and had the nerve to charge us another "key fee" of $10.00! The room was dirty,the sheets had blood on them,and we were only allowed one towel and one wash cloth for the two of us to share. The shower leaked all over,the flooring was coming up,and they had painted what appeared to be latex paint in the bathtub. This is the worst place I have ever stayed in! I wouldn't stay there again if it were free! I do not reccomend this place and think it should be closed down! Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Sketchy....”
Reviews.Author: travelextraordinaire
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty gross. It was super hot in our room and we only had one very small bed. It's a fair walk to the French Quarter; however, you have to walk through a pretty sketchy neighborhood to get there (we actually got chased by some people when returning to our hotel room...yes we had to run back to the hotel). This is not an exageration. If you are on a super-tight budget, like we were, this may be the place for you. Just remember that you get what you pay for... Next time I go to New Orleans I'll shell out some extra cash to keep my sanity.

Reviews.Title: “Empress!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kandystar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the empress oct. 27-29 for voodoo fest. The empress was a non conventional hotel. The staff is very friendly and will go out of their way to help you just as long as you follow the few rules you will have no problem. I felt very safe everything is monitored and the neighborhood isn't bad at all. It felt like staying a friends house. Honestly how much time do you actually spend in your hotel. You don't go to New Orleans to stay in the hotel your entire trip. I recommend this hotel and well probably stay there again. I read all the crazy reviews that people wrote and I was slightly concerned, but I'm a very prissy girl and I managed very well.

Reviews.Title: “Calm Down!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's not the Ritz but it is a decent hotel. The staff is great. It has a cute balcony, basis accommodations with all that you need! The area is typical New Orleans with different races, age groups and lifestyles. The complainers are being a little too uppitty! If you want room service, a pool, spa and all the extras I would not recommend this hotel. However, If you want clean room with free parking and a nice staff for a economical price..this is the place! If you want all the perks try Hilton Riverside or Lapavillion at about 200.00 a night you will surely pay for all the extras.

Reviews.Title: “People need to be fair”
Reviews.Author: jokermanXP
Reviews.Content: I've seen the small, economy, hotel called "Empress" in New Orleans. It think people expected the Hilton rather than reasonable. Furthermore, it has strict rules, it's a SMALL business, and people should read their contracts instead of complaining about refunds and such. If they break the rules, they lose those refunds. The rules seemed straightforwared; no smoking, don't bring pets without notifying them, have ID, return keys when leaving, ask about guests, and so on. If you break them, it's your problem. Furthermore, I've read complaints about the neighborhood: what about it? I'm from Louisiana and so know that, despite it's innocent appearance, the French Quarter is perhaps the most dangerous part of the city. The Empress is situated near, and it takes reasonable precautions: it has cameras, inside and outside, locks doors at 11:30pm (bring an ID to get in), recommends cabs, and so on, there are locks. It's not the best neighborhood, (nor even close to being the worst), but I had no problems walking to and fro in the day. If they recommend a cab, use it, but daytime seemed alright, and I kept with at least one other person. Ask Bob between 7-3 pm about anything, and he'll tell you all you need to know.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times, I love it more each time! The staff is extra friendly and take care of you. The rooms are always clean and pleasent. How could you not love a hotel that provides you with free coffee every morning?!?

Reviews.Title: “Fear, bad smell”
Reviews.Author: sdantas
Reviews.Content: The worst hote I've ever been. Be away from it. Other reviews tells it all...

Reviews.Title: “Only for Singles!.”
Reviews.Author: Amishcowboy
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly, but the room was pretty bad, very small and kinda dirty. Take a taxi back at nite, walk during the day. Got this at last minute, so I shouldn't complain. Place is just run down from lack of neglect. but it is cheap. just for guys though, no way would I let a women stay here!.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WE were down there for the 4th. of July week-end. the worst hotel we have ever stayed in. it stinks, its small, no phone, no clocks, the t.v. did not work right. it was so small they have you to turn your air off when you leave the room,then it takes all day to cool back off. You can not get a refund back no matter what! you pay for your ice the parking is at your own risk. not to mention it is in the worst neiborhood. what ever they say on the web if it is not telling you how bad it is do not believe what you see. because it is the worst place to stay in your life!!!!!!!!!!! and I do mean the worst!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is the Place for You!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you ENJOY complaining, this is the place for you! If you enjoy minimalistic accomodations, this is the place for you! If you enjoy getting what you pay for, this is the place for you! If you don't travel to spend time in your hotel room, this is the place for you! If you are looking for a reasonable price when it's tough to find something in New Orleans, this is the place for you! If you enjoy a pleasant, helpful staff, this the place for you! If you enjoy sitting out on the veranda and enjoying a cup of morning coffee, this is the place for you! There are a ton of negative reviews on the Empress, but they are what they advertise, frugal accomodations close to the French Quarter. You get a double bed in a small (not tiny) room. Clean sheets, a clean bathroom and not much more. You get a small (about 13") television with about 10 local channels and rabbit ears. No phone, clock, alarm, closet for hanging clothes or dresser. One guy was upset about his fear of getting killed, but there is reasonable security precautions taken in a bit of a rough neighborhood. They lock the front door at 11:30 and you have to show ID to get in. You turn your keys in when you leave each time . . . for your protection so that you don't lose your key with the hotel and room number on it. There is always an attendant on duty to return your key to you. The air conditioners in the rooms have individual controls so you can keep the room the way you want them. This is an old-fashioned mom&pop type of no frills motel. If it's all your looking for, this is the place for you! - Bo

Reviews.Title: “Looked at the Room and Ran!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can you spell N-A-S-T-Y? Thank God we were able to look at the room before we actually took our bags out of the car. What we thought was a bell hop was a king size roach. When we walked in I was thinking, okay, the closet is a nice size, but why is there a bed in here? Then we were told that this was the room. So we asked to see one of the larger rooms, again, we were told that we had just stepped into the room, or more like the Twilight Zone. What I thought was a small mirror, turned out to be a TV. The sheets looked like they were standing up greeting us when we walked into the door, and the smell was not the aroma that I was hoping to be enhaling while staying there. My lungs seemed to shut down on me. So my husband and I stepped out side to "think" about it and burned off like the road runner, I think we left skid marks outside. We decided not to chance our car being stolen, or our body contracting something and headed further East on I-10 and actually found a La Quinta for $44.00 a night.... The Empress wanted to charge us $57.00 a night. No thank you! The lady that was helping us was a pleasant woman and I think she was only there because work is work.....

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at in my life”
Reviews.Author: frenchqtrchef
Reviews.Content: Booked a room here for my mom and myself through one of the well-known discount websites. No pictures of the hotel on this site, but I figured the hotel must be okay if it was advertised on this site. I couldn't have been more wrong. When we got there I just wanted to go home. I realized why that was the only hotel I could find that had availability. The parking is free - I guess they feel too bad about the location of the hotel, which is in the worst neighborhood in the city, to charge you for it. Our room was about as big as a closet. One small bed - said to be a double but I had doubts. There was no closet or hangers. Once we had our suitcases in the room there wasn't any room to move around, despite the fact that the small bed was pushed up against the wall. Our bedding was old and smelly and the bedspread had cigarette holes all over it. The bathroom was beyond filthy - I would have felt cleaner taking a bath at the sink at a public restroom. The door had a tiny, flimsy lock on it. The hallway smelled like sewerage - like a toilet had backed up - and the smell got worse every day. The tiny window in our room that had bars on it and didn't open overlooked what must have been a garden years ago. The TV had two channels, no cable, no remote. No radio in the room. I felt like I was in jail. Usually when I go to New Orleans I've had such a busy and tiring day that I can't wait to get back to my hotel room at night to rest, but this particular stay I just wanted to stay away. Do yourself a favor and sleep in your car if you have to.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No clock, no phone, no closet, no clothes rod, no glasses, no cable, no carpet, broken shower rod, grimy floors, thin rough towels which the maid only remembered to replace half the time, old stained sheets that are not changed each morning, clogged shower, dirty old toilet, no fan, no openable windows, old musty airconditioner. Gross. Nice staff. Probably impossible to cancel reservations and get your money back as the rules regarding refunds seem to mysteriously change. Only plus: rooms will make you feel so upset and sick that you'll spend all your time exploring the French Quarter and no time in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Left stranded”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked creepy and is located in a delapitated block. Our reservation was made directly by phone and a confirmation was faxed back. Upon arriving and paying the airport shuttle fare, there were no ROOMs available. The man at the desk was unprofessional and unhelpful inspite of the fact that he was in the wrong. Here we were 2 women visiting NO for the first time , left stranded. Luckily we pulled our resources and found another hotel for the same a bit further from the French quarter for the same rate. I would not recommend this scroungy looking place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “the most crappy hotel i've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room is small, dirty and it stinks. The bed is the worst. Springs came out from underneath. Definitely won't stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Stupid Reservation System”
Reviews.Author: zoewang1980
Reviews.Content: If u want to book the hotel by yourself by calling the hotel directly? Forget it! You will get nothing after a 1-week reservaiton process and even u already give the credit card authoration! The worst thing is you dont even know whether u have ur reservation confirmed because they will ask u to call back again and again and dont tell u anything for 5 days!!!

Reviews.Title: “Donâ€™t be too disheartened”
Reviews.Author: MWheatley
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel months ago in a bit of a rush, afraid that we wouldnâ€™t find anything else during the Mardi Gras period. After booking a non-refundable 7 nights at the hotel I found this website and was absolutely horrified and worried sick for months about the type of hotel we would be staying at. The taxi driver didnâ€™t help; on the way from the airport (approx. 20 minutes) he told us that it was the worst hotel in NO, in the â€˜blackâ€™ neighbourhood, full of crack heads and prostitutes. However, as mentioned before in other reviews, the staff is super, friendly, helpful and kind. The reception area was clean and so was our room. The laminate flooring was clean, the bed sheets looked and smelled clean. The bathroom is very small but everything was working fine; the temperature of the water is changing sometimes. The TV was not so good; it showed about 6 channels of which only 2 were just about watchable. No wardrobes, hangers or hooks to hang anything up on. No room in the bathroom either to store any items. Tiny window that looks out on a dilapidated building and neglected garden. We never felt threatened though, after dark we ensured taking a taxi back, which we would have done anyway regardless of where we stayed. I agree with other reviewers, this hotel is acceptable for a short stay; we changed hotels after 4 nights as we were in dire need of a bit of luxury. But there is plenty to do in NO from early morning till late at night and despite the hotel we had a wonderful time sampling the local traditional food, enjoying the Mardi Gras and mingling with the locals; we will be back, just not at the Empress Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Encourages you to wake up early and come back very late”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed at the Empress for six nites during Mardi Gras 2005 and granted we were NOT in New Orleans for the hotel experience but rather the French Quarter, parades and parties. But I have to say that staying at this hotel was an experience in itself. First let me say that it is a very low budget hotel and once inside we did feel safe. But when outside you should walk with a buddy. One of my friends was mugged two blocks from the hotel and thank God he was not hurt and only lost a few dollars. It is located three blocks from the border or backside of the French Quarter and the neighborhood looks old and in need of a very good paint job. The rooms are small (we were warned of this) and I brought with me an air mattress because of the one double bed. Glad I did because the bed looks so old and used that sleeping on it may be hazardous to one's well being. The carpet looks like it should have been replaced back in 1984. The tv is a small 15 inches plus no cable tv or radio. No closet or drawers to hang clothes on. The window faces a garden consisting of an old tub and weeds. The bathroom is also small and the toilet backed up when we first used it and continued to get backed up each day of our stay. We requested our own plunger so that we could flush and plunge at the same time. The plunger was cheap and it sucked. There is no vanity or counter area in the bathroom and the towels are paper thin. There was a strange odor in the room which only got worse as our stay progressed. The staff is very friendly and helpful and will do anything to best of their ability but the owner needs to renovate this hotel big time. The empress okay for a very short term trip maybe a one nite or two nite at the most. DO NOT have more than two persons per room. Bring your own towels and soap.

Reviews.Title: “Positively surprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Empress online, for a special, non-refundable rate. After this, I read all these horrible reviews of the place and was terrified. We we're going down there with my boyfriend, and I was wondering if the hotel was gonna ruin our vacation. But, I was positively surprised. The rooms weren't big and the paint was chipping, but they we're clean. We got clean towels every day. Someone mentioned dirty sheets in a review, so we brought our own! The hotel sheets were fine, though. The shower worked and the water was warm, the AC was good and the staff was super! We drove down, and we're a little worried about the neighborhood, but our car was unharmed after three nights. We had no worries walking to the French quarter (very close!) during the day, but when we came back after dark, we took a cab. Also, the $10 deposit didn't bother us, nor leaving the key at the desk. In fact, it was nice not to worry about the key, knowing it was safe at the hotel. I can recommend this hotel to anyone who's on a budget and isn't too picky.

Reviews.Title: “If you are in college stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I will tell you the truth if you are a couple and wanting some romantic getaway in the Big Easy stay at the Historic French Market Inn. If you are a college student like me looking to party on Bourbon this place fine. It is a bit ghetto donâ€™t get me wrong. The rooms are really small, but who really cares if you are in the Quarter all night. They don't care how many people you cram in the room. Me and five of me friends stayed in one room. It was crowded as ----- but we were only there to shower and change clothes. The staff is really cool! If you stay here I guarantee you will have a story that you will never forget. If you end up staying there ask for Julius in RM 210 tell him that 5 guys from Kansas says what up!

Reviews.Title: “Don't go Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an inexpensive hotel. I would rather stay in jail...It would be cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Owner is a Liar”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was there in September of 2001, had signed an agreement for a long term stay through september 14th. On the 7th, there was a note on my door that said that all long term agreements were void and everyone had to move out. Then 9/11 happened and all airport traffic stopped, the owner then begged for people to stay. I left. The room was dirty, there was mold and mildew everywhere, the staff was inhospitable. If you are a crack addict looking to hideout, then I would reccomend this place to you. If you are a bank robber hiding out, as was the case this week, then they are your kind of people. The bedding was dirty and I contracted scabies from the sheets. Disgusting!!!!

Reviews.Title: “More garbadge”
Reviews.Author: packratt
Reviews.Content: This is an update to this terrable place. We tried to get a refund from them and they totally lied to our credit card company. They said we were repeat customers which is a surprise to me since I have never been there before. They also said their place has safe doors on all rooms. Big joke!!! Their doors are hollow core doors with cabinit handles on them. I could go on about how bad they are but since I am out of over 1,000.00 on my charge card you can relate how bad this place is.

Reviews.Title: “hell hole”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: unless you are demented you will hate this place .most of the people staying here just got off the greyhound and rent by the week/month . It is filthy -long black hairs everwhere and it also has bugs . The bathrooms are so vile I would not use it .the sheets are so gross , icky and stained . the carpet is filthy as well . this place reminds me of a flop house for the mentally ill and dangerous. seriously it is that bad and the neighborhood is worse ! I slept with one eye open and all my clothes on and would never of done that except they keep your first nights deposit, and my husband is 6 4 and 250. there are places to stay for not alot more , sun and moon is a great place and only 85.( its nearby ) DONT stay here .

Reviews.Title: “What a terrible place”
Reviews.Author: tristemere
Reviews.Content: We found this place on line and the pictures on the website looked fine - so we booked it. We were very suprised when we arrived. The cab driver told us not to walk in the neighborhood at night and the buildings on either side of the hotel had broken windows and looked condemned. The lobby area was filthy and our room did not have a doorknob - you could only open the door using your key as a handle. The room itself was filthy and reeked of cigarette smoke. The toilet did not have a lid and the seat was barely attached - in fact, I did not even use it, I figured it was safer to use a restaurant bathroom. This was not a hotel - it was a flop house. We only stayed long enough to find another hotel. When we checked out, we were charged for the first night even though we had only been there for about 2 hours. We payed cash and the clerk tried to say we hadn't and we had to fight to get our cash back. And then they charged our credit card anyway!! This was a fight that we eventually gave up. Oh - and 2 blocks....hah! Try again. It is cheap, but not worth it. We ended up staying in the Chateau Dupre on Decatur for a few nights - this was a beautiful place. And we stayed our last few nights at the Rue Royal Inn which was very charming, but had lots of stairs. I would highly recommend either one of those hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It's a New Orleans experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the Empress Hotel on a billboard at the Greyhound Station. The sign indicated that the rates were inexpensive and very close to the Quarter. I took the bus to the corner of Rampart Street and Ursulines and easily walked the 2 blocks to the Hotel with no problems. The first night I stayed in a "large", the second night, a "small". The absolute only difference was the amount of space around the bed. I found the place completely acceptable... much better, in terms of cleanliness, than most of the more expensive "economy" places I had stayed in other cities. There was a private bath, air conditioning, color television... what more do you need, really. There was no phone but the desk clerk was more than willing to let me use the phone at the desk whenever I needed it. The only issue I had was that I was planning to stay for several nights, and wasn't permitted to make reservations for the entire stay with the front desk. I was told I would have to to re-register every morning. One day, I left early to go get some breakfast and came back to find my bags had been packed and stored (for some nominal fee) and I had lost the small key deposit. No problem, I got my bags and re-checked in. I did lose my contacts, but that's my fault for leaving them in the ashtray. Bottom line, it's an unbelieveably cheap place to sleep. If you are in New Orleans, what are you doing hanging out in your hotel room all day anyway.

Reviews.Title: “It was alright”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel really isn't THAT bad, for what you pay. The staff was super nice, the floors were clean enough to walk on without shoes, and the toilet flushed. What more can you ask for $89 a nite? I was not at all uncomfortable walking to the hotel at 3 in the morning, all the neighborhood residents that I encountered (at that hour and all other times, too) were friendly, and asked if I was having a pleasant stay. If you are going to New Orleans to party, you probably don't plan to spend much time in your room anyway, and the Empress IS within walking distance of the French Quarter. I will say that the bed was broken, for real, and the air conditioner didn't seem to work right. When the neighbor flushed their toilet, my friend got scalded in the shower. If you want a ritzy room, prepare to pay for it and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Liars!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They actually charged us for a large room. When we saw our friends room which actually was somewhat large (at least compared to our 9x9 room) we confronted the manager about it. She claimed it was a large room. We thought it was a waste of time & maybe they did consider it lg-who knows. Upon checkout the thing we signed listed it as a small room!!! She said she could not refund us the extra $$$. Also, bring your own blankets! I found a band aid in our bed. When we told the lady she laughed it off. Gross. Our carpeted floor was CONSTANTLY sopping wet. Thi9s was a disgusting place and a rip off. I am booking a hotel for $120 a night happily to steer clear of places like that.

Reviews.Title: “Not so bad”
Reviews.Author: amricnpie
Reviews.Content: It wasn't as bad as others are making it out to be. Anyone who is ONLY paying $50 a night to stay in the French Quarter shouldn't expect better. It was clean and relatively safe. The rooms were small and very basic, but satisfactory. The neighborhood does look bad, but the people seemed friendly. My husband and I walked it at night without any problems, though, like any city, I wouldn't walk it alone at night. Get used to it, because the entire French Quarter looks that way. All in all, we had a great time! I am glad that I saved money on the room and spent it elsewhere. I would recommend this hotel to other travelers looking for a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “@$&# THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place really sux, I've seen mice live better. I wouldn't be suprised if we caught crabs from here. This was a very filthy place, very nasty, I have every intention of turning this place over to New Orleans City Hall inspectors.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Place!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this place on the INternet. The web site stated that it was affordable, 2 blocks from the French Quarter, and monitored parking. My husband and I arrived before 3 and when we saw where the place was located, we just about died! It is not 2 blocks from the French Quarter, more like 9! Also, the building looked totally different in person than in the photograph! We saw a lot of sleezy looking people standing on street corners, which reminded you of the projects. The signs in the Parking lot said "Park at Your Own Risk." After looking the place over, my husband and I decided that we could rest and have a good time staying in a hell-hole like this. I called and cancelled our reservation immediately, and they still charged me for one night's stay! Right now we are disputing the charges. We ended up staying at Days INn on Canal Street. The rates are not much higher, they have a secure parking area, and we slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “BAD --Information Misleading . T”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had searched the Internet for a "Nice but affordable place to stay close to the French Quarters with some kind of parking.. We drove in from TX locate d Empress and found the French Quarters to be more than the TWO blocks they state. Upon finding ourselves in a rundown area, dirty falling apart buildings. The building with the "Fresh" paint and a roof not falling in really stuck out . Located the parking area beside the Hotel. A small area you drive into and have to back out No drive thru.. And a sign saying "Park AT YOUR OWN RISK". We arrived early so we decided to cancel and find another HOTEL.. Sitting in the Parking Lot we called and cancelled and received a confirmation number.. Two days later I found out that they had billed us for staying there. We called them back .. BTY the 800 number on the website is uncorrect or they just don't answer it. After speaking to the Desk Clerk about the bill They refused to debit back to our account stating they must have 48 hours in advance.. And it's not stated anywhere. We suggested that we would report to New Orleans Chamer of Commerce and there reply was Go Right Ahead.Life is a Risk but there's no need to take this ONE...

Reviews.Title: “Like Betty say's What a Dump!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just had to laugh when I found the reviews on this crap hole! Anyone who thinks this is a suitable place to stay, no matter how cheap it is has no common sense. My Mother and I had to stay here in May of 2002 because our train connection to Orlando FL. was extreamly late. We saw flyers that advertised $29.00 a night and though why not? But when we arrived by taxi I was concerned, I consider myself to be some what street-wise, but with my 60 year-old Mother in tow, I was afraid that this would be too much for her to bare. As soon as we went up to the front desk, I inquired about the price, AND WAS TOLD THAT THOSE ROOMS WERE NOT AVAILABLE! We were charged the going rate of $57.00! I couldn't believe the room! The only good thing I can say is that the air conditioner worked like a freezer. Oh, and "Aimy" who was at the front desk was very nice, and it was too bad that she had to work in a dump like that. She had to handle a bad guest who was promtly kicked out! Some of the users who claim that this is such a deal for it being cheap and close to the Quarter probably don't care if they sleep in the ditch, whitch is probably more comfortable, but I have a bad back and my Mother is not built for this sort of thing. As for the price, you can stay at plenty of places that charge $65-$75 that are less than a mile away from the action. All you have to do is search for them on a good site like this one. 1 night was ok for needing to flop until Amtrack could get it in gear, but if you want to injoy your stay with out wondering if the hotel owner is America's Most Wanted, then do some research and find yourself a better place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dump with all caps; it should be condemned.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't leave my garbage at this dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found this pit on the internet...The site looked good as did the discription. My thought was....."Too good to be true"....Was that an over statement!!. The room was about 8x8 with duct tape holding things in the bathroom together....I think if you were in a pinch you could get 2 hour or 4 hour rate...But why would you want to do that to yourself?...Definately a dump!! I knew I had a good woman when she was still with me in the morning...Then we found a real hotel!

HotelInfo.Name: Empress Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1317 Ursulines Ave, New Orleans, LA 70116
